acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of David B. Tyler, 1975. Tyler's wife Elizabeth S. Tyler was either friends or cousins with Miss Ethel Fowler, the granddaughter of Joshua Nickerson, from whom they obtained these papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in one folder and one oversize folder by size with no particular arrangement otherwise.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Joshua Budd Nickerson (1825-1863) was married to Mary Jane Foster (1829-1910). They had five children: Herbert Foster Nickerson (1855-1857), Eva Gertrude Fowler (1857-1890), Ada Hyatt Nickerson (1859-1860), Ada Hyatt Hill (1861-1938), and Herbert Foster Nickerson (1863-1905).

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: The collection's accession folder includes a copy of 1975 correspondence between the donor and James P. Hurley, Executive Director of the Long Island Historical Society, which includes an item-level listing of the materials in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Nickerson family papers contain the papers of the Joshua Nickerson family of Sag Harbor, Long Island and Forest Hills, Queens. Documents include wills, mortgages, estate inventories, deeds, and letters. Many of the papers have to do with the estate of Mary J. Nickerson, Joshua's wife, of which the executor was Edward B. Hill (1858-1940), the husband of Mary and Joshua's daughter Ada Hyatt Hill. There are also papers related to some members of the Hedges family, the 1905 will of Herbert Foster Nickerson, and a family tree of Ethel G. Fowler, including the Fowler side of the family. Additionally, there are two commercially printed photographic images of views of Sag Harbor and a booklet, "Abbreviated Descriptive Views of Sag Harbor, N.Y.," published in 1908 by the Village Improvement Society.
